resources.string:
AVAILABLE:
Indicates whether network connectivity is possible. A network is unavailable when a persistent or semi-persistent condition prevents the possibility of connecting to that network

FAILOVER:
Indicates whether the current attempt to connect to the network resulted from the ConnectivityManager trying to fail over to this network following a disconnect from another network

ROAMING:
Indicates whether the device is currently roaming on this network. When true, it suggests that use of data on this network may incur extra costs

TRUSTED:
Indicates that the user has indicated implicit trust of this network. This generally means it's a sim-selected carrier, a plugged in ethernet, a paired BT device or a wifi the user asked to connect to. Untrusted networks are probably limited to unknown wifi AP. Set by default.

VALIDATED:
Indicates that connectivity on this network was successfully validated. For example, for a network with NET_CAPABILITY_INTERNET, it means that Internet connectivity was successfully detected.

DOMAINS:
DNS domains search path set for this link.

LINK ADDRESS:
Identifies an IP address on a network link. An IP address and prefix length (e.g., 2001:db8::1/64 or 192.0.2.1/24). The address must be unicast.

ROUTE INFO:
Describes both static and live network configuration information:
		1) destination IpPrefix (null indicates a default route of the address family implied by the gateway IP Address).
		2) A gateway InetAddress indicating the next hop to use (null indicates a directly-connected route).
		3) An interface.
